Key Match Events: England's World Cup defence began with a punishing nine-wicket defeat in Ahmedabad.
Two majestic hundreds from Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra meant the Black Caps romped home with almost 14 overs to spare.
Conway finished 152 not out while Ravindra reeled off an unbeaten 123.
England scored 282 for nine, but New Zealand chased it down with ease.
New Zealand won the toss and decided to bowl first.
New Zealand won by nine wickets.
Pre-Game Insights: Ben Stokes missed the World Cup opener with a hip injury.
New Zealand won the toss and decided to bowl first.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler admitted that his England side had been 'completely outplayed'.
Buttler mentioned that England were aiming for a score around 330 but fell short.
Joe Root acknowledged that England were below par in all departments.
Rachin Ravindra expressed his disbelief and joy at the performance, mentioning his close relationship with Conway.
